website_summaries.verdict: A popular favorite that blends a spot of Kentucky Bluegrass with other varieties for a versatile grass that's especially good at patching trouble areas.
pros: A great grass for hotter climates at a decent price from a leading brand
Thirsty at first, and a bit temperamental, but handles heat or shade well once it's established
cons: This so-called bluegrass mix is mostly fescue
Some griped there was too much filler in this seed

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: The proof is in the photos!!! I basically gambled on this product and WOW I did no fancy prep... no fancy tools... just raked the dirt a little, spread the seed by hand, watered religiously, then fed with Scott’s recommended grass feed... I HAVE GRASS! I used to have solid dry packed in dirt that flooded when it rained... planted April 10th in NC, ( against all advice from my neighbors haha)
customer_reviews.author: Smalls*

customer_reviews.title: Check the expiration date
customer_reviews.text: If you look at the sticker on the back and you will notice stickers on top of stickers. The 1st sticker (the newest on top) will make this bag seem as if it is still unexpired (current), but if you look closely this sticker has been placed on top of multiple stickers. I wonder if this is why many folks seem to complain about their seeds not growing.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Howard

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this seed was old or what. But in three weeks not a single blade of grass has sprouted. Planted in newly laid top soil. Watered. Nothing but weeds sprouted.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca J Willis

customer_reviews.title: Less than 25% of what you throw down will actually grow.
customer_reviews.text: A lof of this seed didn't grow...I'd say less than 25% of what we put down, grew. We prepped the soil, watered daily, even fertilized but very little came up. Also, they advertise it "spreads" but only bluegrass spreads via rhizome...bluegrass is the smallest percentage of seed they use in this mix.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie C.

customer_reviews.title: Almost zero germination rate
customer_reviews.text: I sowed using this type of grass seeds a few times this spring in multiple spots in lawn. NOTHING sprouted. NOTHING. Something is wrong with the germination rate.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Angelous

customer_reviews.title: Did not sprout.
customer_reviews.text: I used this seed last year with decent results in Southern CA, so I came here to order it, watered faithfully for weeks (not an inconsiderable expense where I live) and had not one single sprout. Accidentally bought from "Amazon Services", but Amazon was helpful in refunding my purchase anyway.
customer_reviews.author: KateTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: The Grass Is Always Greener
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this grass seed on my Wisconsin lawn for years and I am happy with its performance. The areas I use it on are in the sun all day, and this grass holds up well. I planted this seed on October 7, 2016--late for Wisconsin. However, a super warm fall resulted in spectacular germination rates in about ten days. (I planted the seed after lawn aeration and the aeration company was late in performing that service this year). By the time we had any really cold weather, this grass was already established. The lawn should look great next spring. I would recommend this grass seed for super sunny locations in the Midwest.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Decent germination, but lots of weeds
customer_reviews.text: Unless you want to spend the next several months diligently weeding your lawn for hours on end, do not buy this product. Lots of clover and dandelion seed. Lawn was pretreated for weeds and weed-free before I added this seed. You get what you pay for. Germinates well if you water consistently and use good soil. I would not agree that it is heat or drought tolerant at all. If you want drought tolerant, spring for all Bermuda seed.
customer_reviews.author: penelope sharp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Northern Oklahoma. Right now the weather here has been in the 100s. I planted these seeds about 2 weeks ago, and honestly I have forgot to water them as much as I should. Almost gave up and waited until late September because it has been so hot lately.....but here you can see it’s still growing. I will let it do it’s thing and will probably plant more seed where it doesn’t grow. (I’m a first time planter, no experience, everyone told me it wouldn’t grow because of the heat).....proved them wrong lol
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Not Truly Heat Tolerant.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this because it professed to be heat tolerant. As soon as it started to get warm here (I live in northern CA) much of it died and doesn't seem to be revive-able, despite watering it every other day when the weather was just a bit warm and daily when it got hot. I actually purchased two bags of this and am pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: shanfle

customer_reviews.title: A good healthy lawn in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I lost my carpet grass lawn last growing season to grub worms and army worms. I had to remove all grass on that side of yard and level with mulch after treatment of worms. I used this product to reconstruct entire yard. This product filled out in about 2 weeks and is still growing, and getting thicker. Now that 2 months have past, the new grass seed is filling out green. I have the greenest lawn in the neighborhood now with little to no watering once grass was established. I am really impressed and would recommend to anyone in the same situation.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: My go to grass seed
customer_reviews.text: P Would have given 5 stars if package hadn't expired more than a month before I ordered it, however, new grass came up in all but high traffic areas which typically require a second application in spring anyway. This year's summer heat coupled with drought left my lawn in its worst shape ever in 12 years despite watering and TLC. Looks good now and will look better by spring because this seed winters over well - even under four feet of snow!
customer_reviews.author: Legend

customer_reviews.title: Looks like carpet.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second year for this grass seed. It looked good at the end of the first year. This year it looks like carpet. Winterized it in November of last year. Weed and Feed fertilizer in the Spring and reseeded to make it thicker. Everyone asks what type grass it is. I wasn't sure how well it would actually tolerate Mississippi summers but it lives up to the marketing. This year we put it down at my son's new house. It already looks great there too.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Davey

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Effort
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to patch my sunny lawn during the pandemic, so going out to buy sod was not an option. I bought this sunny mix, prepped the patch areas well, and watered frequently. In sunny areas, the germination rate varied from zero to 25%. Totally unacceptable. In shady areas, the rate was maybe 50%, but those were not the sunny areas I wanted patched in the first place. All-in-all a waste of money. Unfortunately I have waited so long to judge the product I am outside the return window. So much for hanging in there and trying to give the vendor the benefit of the doubt,
customer_reviews.author: craigr1971

customer_reviews.title: Would not Grow
customer_reviews.text: I followed all of the instructions and I have an inground sprinkler system that kept the seeds wet but none of them germinated. I still have half a bag of useless seeds! I'm planning to spread them this Winter and hopefully they will germinate after being under the snow for the Winter!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald U. Denmon

customer_reviews.title: I got a bag of bad grass seed
customer_reviews.text: Planted this and tended to it watering it without fail. It's been over 10 days and still nothing but a few sprigs of growth. Save your money. Sad a lot of work went into this planting.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen S. Eklund

customer_reviews.title: 10 days, good weather, days of light rain, not a hint of any grass
customer_reviews.text: I spread seed out in our back yard 10 days ago (guides says 6-10 days to germination). The weather has been great for gardening 65-75 degrees every day. I watered for the first two days, and then we had 5 days of off and on rain, perfect for seeding. None of this seed germinated, zero. This was a bad batch, I don't know, but we won't have another great weather window like this to try to plant again. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Diane C

customer_reviews.title: Seed good, beware buying from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this seed for a few years now, it takes much longer to grow than some but the end result is great however I must have gotten an old batch from Amazon because I got below 50% germination rate. I'd buy it again but not from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: kennelhater

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Not one single blade of grass grew
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Not one single blade of grass grew. I see what others are complaining about. I don't have the bag anymore, but I see comments about expired seeds with new stickers. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Alicat

customer_reviews.title: Barely any grass grew (while other seed by 2 different companies did)
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Planted this grass at the same time as 2 other kinds, JRK and Pennington. Scott’s barely grew, even though it went on the most hospitable soil I have. All grasses got the same treatment in terms of water and fertilization. The other two germinated faster and at about 90% rate, whereas Scott’s germinated at about 10-20% rate tops. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rabbit with watch

customer_reviews.title: Nice blue color
customer_reviews.text: I liked how much bigger the bag was than I expected. It spreaded great over my bare front grass. Will wait a few weeks to see true growth results. Seller delivered it a day earlier which I like. Thank you seller.
customer_reviews.author: joan underwood

customer_reviews.title: fairly good product if used with fresh potting soil to cover the seeds.
customer_reviews.text: overseed germination in standard soil was slow and only about 50% yield. however, on a few bare spots, i overseeded and sprinkled commercial potting soil over the seeds, the germination was much quicker and i got about 80% germination. as i continue repairing my lawn, i will use potting soil to cover all patches since it provided more successful growth.
customer_reviews.author: G. Koscal

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I prepped the area, put down the seeds, watered, covered with some top soil and watered again. Continued to water 2-3 times a day. Finally after almost 3 weeks I started to see some sprouts. Only about half of the seeds sprouted. They are also very thin blades of grass. I should have just gone and bought some sod at home depot and been done with it. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: CZ

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Several seasons of compacted grass and moss killed off a large are of the front yard. Raked out the hard pack, laid down a fairly heavy layer of seed, then covered with a thin layer of dirt. Stayed on top of the watering and 2 months later, a decent fill of grass. Looks like about 80% fill rate. Will have to wait for the hot weather to see how heat resistant it is.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crowder

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased I think two bags of this by now in hopes that it would work and I have been using it for a few months now and it just doesn't work. I've even laid down new ground dirt and no matter what I do to the ground this seed never sprouts grass. I just would never buy this product again
customer_reviews.author: airforce

customer_reviews.title: This grass actually grows!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried to find grass that would grow for YEARS! Finally, I used this and I have beautiful green grass! Unfortunately, their clover seed doesn't work whatsoever, but this grass is amazing! Water is heavily twice a day and you'll have a nice thick green lawn in no time! If I could do it, anyone can, believe me!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Scott's grass seed
customer_reviews.text: Waste of time. I've never had more trouble growing grass. Had a small area to grow in front of house. Watered daily sometimes twice it rained also. I checked expiration date seemed alright. After 2mos small amount grew. Very disappointed in product. I switched to Pennington grass. Hope I have better results.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Quick comparison: local was better
customer_reviews.text: So I bought a bag of this at the local Ace hardware, and used it in the back yard where it is growing gangbusters. Three days earlier, I used this bag in the front yard where about 10% has germinated. Same prep, same treatment. I figure it was just older seed. I’m not happy.
customer_reviews.author: sundaymorning

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Turned area where applied brown and nothing grew. Had to then buy extra soil and seed to mend the areas that died, and my water bill increased.
customer_reviews.author: MiMi

customer_reviews.title: 0% germination. Save your money
customer_reviews.text: We tilled the ground. spread the seed. lightly covered with topsoil. watered lightly daily. It's been 3 weeks and we don't have a single blade of grass. Still on the hunt for grass that will grow in the high desert of Colorado. This isn't it. Sadly, it's wasted money, because we can't get a refund because we used it so there's nothing to send back. feeling scammed.
customer_reviews.author: Terrill Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Fake product - No germination at all
customer_reviews.text: We tried this product to reseed our lawn multiple times in the past few months. We did all we are supposed to do (clearing the thatch, loosening the soils, watering 4 times a day for 3 weeks etc.) but no germination, ever. Before we gave up, we planted the seed in a flower pot and kept perfect temperature and humidity for 3 weeks. Still no germination. As a comparison, the non-Scotts seed we bought from a local store germinated almost 100% in ~1 week under the same conditions. We have to conclude this is a fake product. Don't be fooled by the green coating on the seed that pretends to be "professionally" treated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my soil was weak, but this stuff was a dissapointment
customer_reviews.author: USA1

customer_reviews.title: Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed Heat-Tolerant Blue Mix is garbage and didn't grow or germinate.
customer_reviews.text: I put down the Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed Heat Tolerant Blue Mix along with Scotts Turf Builder Starter Food for New Grass Plus Weed Preventer. I followed all manufacturer directions such as watering, time of the year and on new soil. The grass seed is garbage, it did not grow. I also planted a no name grass seed for shady parts of the lawn that did grow. I find it unfortunate that I spent more money on a Scotts branded Grass Seed that is garbage and didn't grow. It was a waste of time and money. Certainly not worth spending more money on the Scotts brand of Grass Seed.
customer_reviews.author: Verified Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Blue sprinkles for your yard
customer_reviews.text: Used this for over seed, great weather for weeks, wet but not too wet, warm but not too warm. After 5 weeks, zero results. If you want blue sprinkles for your yard, I would recommend the candy variety, cheaper and equally effective at growing grass.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Lee Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Tragic!  Zero Germination After 9 days of Love
customer_reviews.text: I'm guessing this product has been sitting in a warehouse for years and is now lifeless. I've closely followed the Scotts overseeding guide. No life after 9 days. I've reached out to Scotts for input. I'll report back if something amazing happens.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Newell

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent results - may or may not be related to the seed performance
customer_reviews.text: I had four patches of newly mid-September seeded lawn (3 in the sun & 1 in the shade). Good results in the area automatically watered by a Garden T 1030 Plus timer and seeded with this year's seed. Ok results in 2 of the 3 manually watered areas that had a few missed waterings and were mostly seeded with a seed package from last year & some seed from this year's package. There was no germination in the shaded area closest to the house that was kept continually moist. All the areas were cultivated, raked, fertilized with Starter Fertilizer & covered with straw.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G

customer_reviews.title: Very poor yield!
customer_reviews.text: Aerated, scarified, and top dressed. Watered daily and got a yield of under 25%. Despite applying at a rate of 1 bag per 3000sqft for overseeding, you can see from the pic how poor they germinated. Will not buy this Scott's product again.
customer_reviews.author: Aventinus

customer_reviews.title: Did not grow
customer_reviews.text: Save your money did not grow followed directions 100 % the cheap off brand grew 100% I dug up the blue coated seed still no growth save your money may have been old stock very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: A . C. DELLARAGIONE

customer_reviews.title: Scott s it's not like it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Seed was covered in blue. Shocker. Does in bare spots. Watered, watered and watered. Finally started to come up. Spotty all over. Also used another brand of seed. Wanted Scott's but out so settled on this other brand. It's coming up also but not as spotty.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Collins

customer_reviews.title: Good Coverage. High Germination.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a lot of different grass seeds and this one is the best that I have used. No bare spots in the area I spread the seeds. Grass came in thick and very green (watered twice a day, morning and evening, until grass was about an inch tall then cut it to watering once a day in the evenings). Super happy! Will purchase again for when we do our front lawn.
customer_reviews.author: emily gale

customer_reviews.title: Preliminary
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Thu 11 Jul 2019, delivered today 13 Jul. " GRASS SEED MIXTURE LOT# 19020982 TESTED FEB 2019 SELL BY MAY 2020. " THAT's as good as it gets. I won't be applying until around Labor Day when it cools a bit. I'll update with my results later ...
customer_reviews.author: neognomic

customer_reviews.title: Won't grow
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst grass seed I ever used. I watered it every day for 4 weeks and not one piece of grass sprouted. I think the blue coating keeps the seed from getting wet, so it never sprouts. Next time, I will use uncoated seed.
customer_reviews.author: GREEN-HORNET

customer_reviews.title: Slow to germinate
customer_reviews.text: It's very slow to germinate. In fact, it seems that only a fraction of seeds are viable. When compared with other "touch up" grass seed, this one is most disappointing. It looks like I will need to go to a different brand to see any grass to come up. [ PS. I intended to refresh already exiting grass and fill empty patches]
customer_reviews.author: agnieszka g.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money not a single seed grew this was such a waste of my time and money and by the time you figure it out it’s gonna be past the return window and you’re stuck with a giant bag of grass seed that is useless
customer_reviews.author: Firefly25

customer_reviews.title: Poor germination
customer_reviews.text: I live in Ga I brought this to overseed my fescue after the long summer...and I have to say that germination is really poor...I would estimate about a 45% success...needless to say...won't be going back to this in the future
customer_reviews.author: W. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Big Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I used this seed on several spots on my lawn and watered the spots at least three times a day, especially when it is hot. Very few tiny blades of grass came up and didn't continue to live. I suspect these seeds were old. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: shopperme

customer_reviews.title: Great to use on patches
customer_reviews.text: This is the best grass seed hands down in Central Indiana. I had to return mine, as it came busted in the box, but I've been buying it for years now. Any little patch I need to dig and fix in my yard, I use this.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda the Shadowcat

customer_reviews.title: 5% growth only with optimal conditions
customer_reviews.text: Only 5% of the seed grew from the 2 bags purchased. I planted a third bag of different seed at the same time and got great results - meaning there was sufficient water and climate was suitable. I believe the see was old. Seeking refund
customer_reviews.author: Mike Minnich

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Not one seed germinated . Tried on bare spots with absolutely no luck.
customer_reviews.author: John Polizzi

customer_reviews.title: Growing in lousy soil!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased that this seed germinated well and, with regular watering, is growing nicely. The soil where this seed was planted was poor with lots of tiny rocks. Pleased with result.
customer_reviews.author: Ispeakcat

customer_reviews.title: Failed to produce :(
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product in the past and had good results. But, for some reason that's not the case with this order. Needless, to say I'm a bit disappointed. Maybe, just need more product or more time.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Frugal

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product in the past and when I was too lazy to go to the store it was easy to have it delivered to my house. Grass seed Helps the lawn look more thick and full
customer_reviews.author: Keystonegirl

customer_reviews.title: Scotts has always been a great product. I have been a customer for years
customer_reviews.text: Scotts has always been a great product. I have been a customer for years. Only problem this year was, I put down 2 bags on a Saturday, watered it each day, and the following Thursday we had a torrential down pour for two days and it washed away all the seed. So much for the water absorbing seed. Very expensive wash out !!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dime.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second order of this grass seed. I have an area in the yard that we didn't get to with our first order. I love the grass mixture that is in this product. My yard looks better than ever.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Gibb

customer_reviews.title: Original "Freshness" Sticker Replaced
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't know if there is a problem with the seed I purchased or not. It is obvious that the original sticker on the bag, which stated how long the seed if good for, was pasted over with a second one. If you try and peel it off, it makes the bottom one illegible. By nature, I am a cynical attorney, but I am trying to come up with a legitimate reason Scott's would do this. PERHAPS SOMEONE FROM SCOTT'S CAN ANSWER THIS QUESTION?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fall 2019 formula: <3% bluegrass
customer_reviews.text: shouldn’t be subscribe & save eligible. other reviews mention much different ratios, but the bag shipped to me in August 2019 has 2.88% heat tolerant bluegrass. At that level, it’s REALLY hard to believe the ‘heat tolerant bluegrass’ headline isn’t intentionally misleading.
customer_reviews.author: mmdc

customer_reviews.title: It's 💩💩💩😥😢😢 money down the drain
customer_reviews.text: Nothing not 1 d*mn seed sprouted I'm so disappointed in this brand as I have heard so many good things about it now $57 down the drain this product is truly 💩💩💩💩💩💩💩💩💩💩💩💩💩💩💩💩DONT PAY THAT PRICE LEARN FROM OTHERS AND READ REVIEWS
customer_reviews.author: Alina Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Nothing grew
customer_reviews.text: I read the mixed reviews and decided to try it. Well nothing has grown! I raked first and after spreading the seeds. We have had a lot of rain but nothing.. I’ll have to try something else..
customer_reviews.author: Sandra DiGiacomo

customer_reviews.title: New grass
customer_reviews.text: Watered the lawn 3 times a day for 2 weeks after just throwing them onto the existing grass. The result is lots of bright green new grass, these seeds work.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Did not grow.
customer_reviews.text: This seed never even grew ...I used it to reseed my current lawn. I went through 3 bags ...none of which grew. In fact I still can see some of the blue seed in my grass where it never grew., 2months later.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Product
customer_reviews.text: This heat tolerant blue grass will help you to never aerate your lawn if you live in the south. It will fill in patch's on its own and remains healthy- great product
customer_reviews.author: Italianbuilder1

customer_reviews.title: I've used this product before and really liked it, but can no longer find it locally
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product before and really liked it, but can no longer find it locally. After three weeks, the seed still has not germinated, so I wonder if I got last year's grass seed.
customer_reviews.author: Ed M

customer_reviews.title: Old
customer_reviews.text: The seed must have been old because it never even sprouted on blade of grass and I worked really hard to soften the soil and everything that it said to do.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Great if it sprouts
customer_reviews.text: I tilled and watered the soil at the proper time of year but I’d say 3/4 came up. I’m probably going to stick with a cheaper brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: DeepSouthBulldawg

customer_reviews.title: Very little growth
customer_reviews.text: I maybe saw a few specs of new grass popping up here & there. But it definitely did not cover the area I needed it to. I wouldn’t purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed
customer_reviews.text: I've had pretty good luck with Scotts products so I stick with them . Must be used in a logical manner to work. Keep seed covered and moistened ,ground prepped/raked etc
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didnt grow.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't get any germination with these seeds. I did everything you should when planting seeds, but nothing worked.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Looking good in the shade
customer_reviews.text: Trying to fix up the yard to sell the house. Struggled to get anything to grow in the shade, but this grass seed did. Now I’m watching it grow!
customer_reviews.author: Spunky

customer_reviews.title: very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I am a regular customer of Scott's products and have been using these for years but the most recent batches i purchased here were total and complete duds. Epic failure. I follow instructions carefully and take great care to patch up the lawn but all i got this time was alot of blue sludge in my soil.
customer_reviews.author: ECS1

customer_reviews.title: Avoid using in warm climates.
customer_reviews.text: Grows nicely in cool weather. Completely died in warm weather. All traces of this grass I planted are now brown or dust.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Really fast germination if done right.
customer_reviews.text: My yard is mostly shade throughout the day, it was really hard to grow bermudagrass. So i rented a tiller, and dug up the entire lawn. Before i seeded i spread out scotts starter, and weed and crabgrass preventer. Only 6 days later with temps 75°F and above, watered twice a day, my whole yard has 1 to 2" growth with sprouts still coming up.
customer_reviews.author: JON

customer_reviews.title: Nothing grew!
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed that after a month absolutely nothing grew, not even weeds. I’m not sure where the little tufts of grass came from but it certainly isn’t 1500 ft.2 of grass.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Currie, Author

customer_reviews.title: then it looks horrible
customer_reviews.text: It lasts for 2 weeks , then it looks horrible
customer_reviews.author: David Bialski

customer_reviews.title: Bad seed
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely unsatisfied with this. I can honestly say that not one single blade of grass grew from this.
customer_reviews.author: Rsanders

customer_reviews.title: Not a single seed grew.
customer_reviews.text: Total waste of money. Planted mid April. Ideal weather conditions it rain movie 9 12 days and after 2 weeks not a single seed is showing that it's grown at all.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cormier

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY; FULL OF CLOVER
customer_reviews.text: Grass geminated poorly and was FULL OF CLOVER!!!!! I have spend spending way more than the seed cost in chemicals to kill the clover each year
customer_reviews.author: JPSilver

customer_reviews.title: Only seed without clear instruction
customer_reviews.text: approx. 3 Lb seed but short of detailed instruction how to plant the seed. I need to search google to have plant method but I don't if it works or not.
customer_reviews.author: Whibster Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Didn't really work...
customer_reviews.text: Grass seed is expensive, so I'm always bummed when it doesn't take. It's hot and dry here, but giving plenty of water, still hasn't sprouted.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Seed
customer_reviews.text: Good germination - once I raked it in. The first application I made I left on top of the soil and the birds found it. Definitely need to rake it in so it is covered and not tempting for the birds.
customer_reviews.author: Max Remley

customer_reviews.title: BOUGHT SEVERAL BAGS--NO GERMINATION
customer_reviews.text: PREPARED SOIL, IRRIGATED DAILY, AFTER 3 WEEKS--NOT ONE BLADE OF GRASS--NO MORE SCOTTS PRODUCTS FOR ME, I EVEN PUT THEIR STARTER FERTILIZER--WASTE OF MONEY--NO MORE SCOTTS HYPE
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey j rogers

customer_reviews.title: Now I have grass!
customer_reviews.text: I live in Texas and my backyard was only mud. I threw the seeds on a rsiny day and now I got grass. Just make sure to water it a lot
customer_reviews.author: Erick M.

customer_reviews.title: Not good results, barely saw any thickening and it seemed to dry out quickly
customer_reviews.text: Followed the directions watering daily and everything, but it still didn't improve the lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Bugalydosh

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I follow the instructions and nothing happens already 3 weeks and the seeds are the same nothing grows.
customer_reviews.author: Claus

customer_reviews.title: left bare spots
customer_reviews.text: worked for the most part but didn't take everywhere hopefully will fill in, in the future
customer_reviews.author: W. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: no growth at all
customer_reviews.text: Simply, nothing has grown. I followed instruction and watered as insructed. But nothing happened. It has been three weeks but there is no sign at all!
customer_reviews.author: Esper

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: June 15, 2017 One of three test batches for a new lawn because I didn't know what type of grass I wanted. Started growing within a week of planting. Watered twice a day. So, looking good, small blades and coming in thick- see pic. I will post more pics as it grows.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I can work just not for me
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work in a lot of areas of my lawn but it’s probably the Fl heat and sand
customer_reviews.author: Anna B

customer_reviews.title: Good but pricey
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but we think it’s a good product for our area, SE TN. We mixed It with another type for better coverage.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Green thick grass
customer_reviews.text: This grass seed came up better than a more expensive brand that we tried first.
customer_reviews.author: Norma L. Heidrich

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: No complaints and so far no weeds mixed in with the seeds just grass.
customer_reviews.author: Nelms Family

customer_reviews.title: From the Munster to the Dallas front yard.
customer_reviews.text: Before spreading Scott’s turf builder our grass was like the Munster’s front yard. Now, I feel like I am living like the Dallas mansion 🤣. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Peace2all

customer_reviews.title: despite everything it never germinated
customer_reviews.text: I spread it out over about 600 square feet of lawn to thicken my grass and set the sprinklers to water it and keep it wet automatically ....never sprouted complete waste of money and water bill.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice grass seed
customer_reviews.text: Grew right away love this stuff. Nothing else would grow this did.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Seeds were useless.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly none (visible) seeds germinated. Covered well, watered just enough to keep moist. It’s been months and still bare spots.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Zero germination
customer_reviews.text: This was a total waste of money. Not one seed germinated. Watered daily.
customer_reviews.author: lbp

customer_reviews.title: No signs of grass yet.
customer_reviews.text: Pricey. No signs of grass yet. Will let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Zanne63

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR TEXAS
customer_reviews.text: It is a great deal, Cheaper than Lowe's. the seeds started to grow after one week (don't forget to water every day). but I read the label, this is not for TEXAS. hope they will survive.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: Bad seed again
customer_reviews.text: Last time to buy Scott products. Have watered had rain for a week and the coating still all over the seed no sign again of germination. The worst is having to keep dogs away from the seed coating this long rediculous. Will not purchase Scott again its a flop
customer_reviews.author: Debra S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: I can grow any type of plant from seed but these didn’t even sprout . A whole bag of dud seeds. Do not buy .
customer_reviews.author: brocten

customer_reviews.title: Follow directions and it will work
customer_reviews.text: It’s been six days since we laid the seed down and it’s already germinating very well. We have kept soil moist by water 3-4 X daily. We live in Florida and high has been about 90 with lows around 75 at night. We prepped the soil prior since there was nothing back here before with top soil and manure mix.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

product_meta.title: Scotts Turf Builder Grass Seed Heat-Tolerant Blue Mix For Tall Fescue Lawns, 3 Lb. - Full Sun and Partial Shade -Superior Resistance to Heat, Drought and Disease - Seeds up to 750 sq. ft.
product_meta.description: Size:3 LBScotts Turf Builder Grass Seed Heat-Tolerant Blue Mix for Tall Fescue Lawns grows 33% thicker than ordinary tall fescue. This mix recovers quickly from heat and drought, and it spreads quickly to repair wear and tear on your lawn. Each seed is wrapped in a unique 4 in 1 WaterSmart PLUS Coating that absorbs 2x more water than uncoated seed, feeds with essential nutrients, and helps protect seedlings from disease. Designed for full sun and partial shade, medium bladed texture and high drought resistance. Quickly recovers from heat and drought and spreads to repair wear and tear. Grow Quicker, Thicker, Greener Grass. Guaranteed.
feature_bullets: Designed for full sun and partial shade, and high drought resistance
4 in 1 WaterSmart PLUS Coating absorbs more water than uncoated seed, feeds with essential nutrients and helps protect seedlings from disease
Includes Scotts best seed, helps protect seedlings against disease, keeps seed moist 2x longer than uncoated seed and feeds to jumpstart growth
Mix of tall fescue and bluegrass seed for deep roots and durability
